inclusion.criterion: having a good understanding of French language (read, write, speak, listen)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient attending an appointment in a centre participating to the trial
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patient affiliated to a health insurance scheme
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient giving his informed consent and accepting the modalities of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient agreeing to attend up to 4 appointments dedicated to the study, during 8 weeks after the initial appointment (motivational interview)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient in possession of an internet-enabled smartphone or tablet
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patient has a personal e-mail address
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient agreeing to be registered within the system of text-based recalls for the duration of the study
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patient having previously benefited from a periodontal therapy (less than 1 year ago)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: or currently enrolled in a periodontal therapy program
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient having previously benefited from an oral hygiene motivation session less than 1 year ago
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient has had a calculus removal procedure less than 1 month ago
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient bears orthodontic appliances (any kind, for 1 or both arches)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient bears removable dental prosthesis (any kind, for 1 or both arches)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient allergic to benzoic acid preservatives (or thought to be)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient has a high risk of infective endocarditis
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: A 67-year-old healthy woman came to the clinic to have her flu shot in early October. She works at a rehab center and has no underlying disease.
